org.htwk.graphplot.expression.core

Class Operation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.htwk.graphplot.expression.core.Operation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Add, Divide, Multiply, Negative, Power, Subtract

    public abstract class Operation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Expression
    This abstract class is a prototype for any operation which should later be implemented. It automatically loads all extending classes using reflections for a inversion-of-control behavior. Extending classes must have in addition to unimplemented method two static fields:
    • public static String operationString
    • public static OperationImportance operationImportance
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sophie Eckenstaler, René Martin

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Operation.OperationImportance
      This enumeration is used to give operators the possibility to be calculated before others by having a higher importance.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.LinkedList<OperationInformation> availableOperations 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Operation()
      Prototype constructor for an operation combining two undefined expressions (two instances of the number 0 are used instead)
      Operation(Expression expressionBeforeOperator, Expression expressionAfterOperator)
      Prototype constructor for an operation combining two expressions

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static OperationInformation getOperationInformationForOperator(java.lang.String operationStringToLookFor)
      Searches the List of all operation information for the one which holds a given operator string.
      static void loadAllOperators()
      This method should be called once at the startup of the project to load all classes extending Operation and making them accessible through the static list Operation.availableOperations.

      Sets the expression after the operator.

      • loadAllOperators

        public static void loadAllOperators()
        This method should be called once at the startup of the project to load all classes extending Operation and making them accessible through the static list Operation.availableOperations.

      • getOperationInformationForOperator

        public static OperationInformation getOperationInformationForOperator(java.lang.String operationStringToLookFor)
                                                               throws InvalidExpressionException
        Searches the List of all operation information for the one which holds a given operator string.
        Parameters:
        operationStringToLookFor - The operator string to search for.
        Returns:
        The operation information containing the searched operator string
        Throws:
        InvalidExpressionException - is thrown if an operator string is searched which was not previously registered.
